document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

4D69D1171649470FA17B419CECD04AA0.description:
Accurately use grade-appropriate general, academic, and content-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and those that are key words of a particular topic (e.g., “wildlife,” “conservation,” and “endangered” when discussing animal
preservation).

1226D13675004011988213BC66B7D34B.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking,
and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

517750F825D84314B3507D2175F29243.description:
Distinguish meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of
certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

28646AC2BBC84832A0B351A43809ABDE.description: Explain the meanings of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

925DE6F8B8764F3E8C47875F190AE0C5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

23031F3C089B4547B51D7865A035A825.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

B90B96972CD7412BBAFC7810BF3A3D44.description:
Use both digital and print beginning dictionaries and thesauri to determine or clarify the
precise meaning of key words and phrases.

2470E01966B94280B2BAEA57D0102BA8.description:
Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root
(e.g., joy/joyful).

986DE3DB75AD4F3E954461DC90C5153A.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word that is formed when a prefix or suffix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless,
heat/preheat).

B808DC7B97134A4097312891E2D19B2A.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

0278269363AE4C43BA7A74F75A150118.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on class reading
and content area study, choosing from a variety of strategies, including context clues, illustrations, etc.

047872C955D64E5EAC721C2896446E68.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and
consulting reference materials.

43487318523C4E4FA17044FFFEA31BEE.description: Compare formal and informal English usage.

A6A1435AF8D147988BA4EF63D50B5CFC.description:
With support, apply differences between the conventions of spoken and written English with
some degree of accuracy though not perfectly.

D03DE8504D974B498CAA54DE9E95FE19.description:
Choose words and phrases for different purposes (e.g., slang, written vs. spoken, formal vs.
informal).

91B19DA3C10542C59C7140AB20E9A9DF.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

46EBB69A634B4C78AE1519FD9F215D0C.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and
comprehension.

33E245C57AC74CAB983993ED652726E5.description:
Consult reference materials, including dictionaries, as needed to find words alphabetically and
to check and correct spelling.

4CD2BB1FAFF745619CF2610B12D62540.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

FCE8B70DAFC9460793148FCE30CA5628.description: Use commas and quotation marks to indicate direct speech and quotations from a text.

049FA5C1ACD546D5A97556440A1ECB69.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

2F62E9CC96E0435F86FF1BF41603D653.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

EB3FC2555E5644298D2EDED19FADC798.description: Form and use comparative adjectives and verbs (fast, faster, fastest).

A1B7203DF8A543AEB41AF138FD247F84.description: Use abstract nouns to convey ideas, emotions, or feelings (e.g., freedom, happiness).

1D64BD4CB57440DB95E49A72AF73406A.description: Correctly use frequently confused words/homonyms (e.g., to/too/two, there/their).

1BE1EADF04C442709B35804BD32C9389.description: Use conjunctions in writing and speech (e.g., and, but, for, nor, or, so).

742A117468F244D892243C8A6ACE8218.description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

C8E6BC63E7864E30BE97361422CEE5B9.description: Apply appropriate adverbs to modify verbs.

5247B4B579A140C49F8110472789170E.description:
Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., “a small red bag”
rather than “a red small bag”).

E3153130F4D34DFE835836EAAC603384.description: Use modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

BE7A33D07AF34D8FB16680576F3B233D.description:
Form and use the progressive verb tenses (e.g., I was walking. / I am walking. / I will be
walking.).

0C076EF8D8A84DEE88AB250B585F4D16.description:
Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when,
why).

67A11076E4844C0C905A3B4215D212CB.description:
Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage when writing (e.g., using various sentence types, such as
compound, complex, and simple).

FCEDDC1BE15B4881BDFB697B5FC6D44D.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

EAC267E15F1D4B53A7F9239D17A5FD27.description:
Write routinely over extended periods of time (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter periods of
time (a single sitting or 1–2 days) for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

0DEC0E9732FC4213889F3AB7FDDD3989.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

A0F0575D6BAE42108BAB000B766431B3.description: Identify details from literary and informational texts in writing to support understanding and reflection.

9A4F9FA9ADAC48CB9227E53C575FE08D.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

1A797B522607462BB22A4D48DCA44A30.description:
Conduct or participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., record science observations or read several
books on a single topic to produce a report).

179E746CE51C4C1E82A9B497DC037B19.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

50594877E03C45E7A801D6053919B5BD.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use the
internet to gather information or a word processor to generate and collaborate on writing).

AF6AED13C122433DB13D2E4A18720518.description: Use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

B75ABB161B4043B787A3330ACD95B906.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

C8A2E0D4F3B946CCA3867ECAF7A86714.description: Use digital tools to produce and publish writing individually or with peers.

F85CBC84609943C7BD79F352C06204FB.description:
Improve writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing with guidance and support from
adults and feedback from peers.

74782E0301654E369ED650E2AB00B6A9.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. Apply appropriate sentence structure
and word order.

312A85F9CEDC435F8F16383CCB3984F9.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and
publishing).

825FD1B8C0474351A4F7BDA667EAB947.description:
Write to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, clear event sequences, transitional words, and other cohesive devices in paragraphs of 5 or more sentences. (Include 4 or
more words per sentence.)

8553128A801744D299264F72D7D4B258.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

4BA7342AF06446A9A22F871E0972E007.description: Write formal and informal letters with correct form and accurate punctuation, including greeting, body, and closing in paragraphs of 5 or more sentences. (Include 4 or more words per sentence.)

B8D4F5BF1D254372A6D73012FE32E8FA.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

767F8C1C7F8E46BA982EE448010778F1.description: Balance statements with modal verbal expressions that show mood or uncertainty (e.g., can, could, would, should, will, etc.).

99E4EB18A8F242E6BD841FB01C529BA8.description:
Share and support ideas, attitudes, and opinions, providing concise reasoning about an event, experience, or reading using textual evidence or adding relevant background knowledge on the subject matter in paragraphs of 5
or more sentences. (Include 4 or more words per sentence.)

78C66911E0004FB89D321548C486B260.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

DD2C953C57D94516AF2CF4FF0D76D1F1.description: Read and comprehend historical fiction, timelines, poetry, and other types of passages of appropriate complexity.

AB507D39480F4006BD13596D1934D53F.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

7300B4373A8E493FBD27F45C67BF9F3A.description:
Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two informational
texts on the same topic.

809284561A3242738B2A9AA8D63F8A55.description:
Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about
the same or similar characters (e.g., from a book series).

4D7FB2FE8C5C4E0A936ECA51DEE6EB98.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

4C0469511CFE4AD2AB254CB43B94CABD.description:
Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence), including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive
writing and knowledge of their qualities.

A09CE6E94910437890C133536F5A55B4.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

3AC857396826413487BB431AA85643B1.description:
Use information acquired from the illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and words in an informational text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how
key events occur).

D23380F6F046489C98C305C344C15EF1.description:
Explain how specific aspects of a literary text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by
the words in the story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

9B0E1F7ECDD14633BFD7D6A327F78FB2.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

2691B27A76FD4215A280E0200D46C183.description: Distinguish one’s own point of view from that of the author of an informational text.

0C024C2630FE4DC197962409AB22DB6E.description: Distinguish one’s own point of view from the author, narrator, or characters in a literary text.

7807C921B41A43A986D51028D37E9C21.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

5CA80CF4BF834D9DBF52A4BC7D8E2D34.description:
Explain how text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) help to
efficiently locate information relevant to a given topic in informational texts.

A2D12AF6B6D44C208294CE0AF0565A91.description: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza. Describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

2CD18E8E31A64C9B8D478ED1F9DBE506.description:
Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections,
chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

CFD0ACE394EC4E31816D57C3C8D69281.description:
Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in an
informational text.

99101B203BAA47D4BAE5EF59310D4002.description:
Determine the meaning of general, academic, and content-specific words and phrases in an
informational text.

75D8419359504AA7A4907B0C2F05D24A.description:
Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply
rhythm and meaning to a story, poem, or song.

8FD5554BDD02489683198653DB4B48BF.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text, distinguishing
literal from figurative language.

12C212CCEB0645BB857C8E4CF540D722.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

DFA9EBF2F9814B2EA4230EBBC20415AD.description:
Use the 5W and 1H questions to identify individuals, events, relevant ideas, or pieces of
informational text.

BDB59DAE0C724AA6B0866A27AA43F6C7.description:
Describe the relationship among a series of historical events, scientific concepts, or technical procedures in an informational text using language that pertains to time, sequence, and
cause/effect.

EC52E40719354B979A954F4966258942.description:
Use the 5W and 1H questions to identify characters, settings, and major events in a story or
read-aloud.

11E9CCCBA99C44B4B531C6435918FE40.description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

1FD8698C403544B5BC0D651BB0C5A55A.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

F2BFDD0A058548458A149134616FFBFE.description:
Retell key details of a multi-paragraph informational text and determine the main topic and the
focus of specific paragraphs within the text.

4CAEE3B02FB04240816777D36A14DAA8.description:
Determine the main idea of an informational text. Recount the key details and explain how they
support the main idea.

FAE00A92C8554762B8F97B01BE3E7139.description:
Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures. Determine the
central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

AC1EE67EC0A4415A898137DFC9EDBBD1.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

48EAFFACC05B426ABEF5445334F38CD1.description:
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the
text as the basis for the answers.

7B506CFC4DE2458AA6337737F134C146.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

B9C8D7D89CE34362809FDAD5F1AF4E40.description: Use in-depth critical reading of a variety of relevant texts to describe ideas, events, cultural identities, genres, and literary elements by predicting, making inferences and conclusions.

1005B69AAF28494CA5C2B4F24AD5F949.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

870A1872482B469AA0209EDB5D0EFE0A.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

A2980DE07DB74E8EA9914B54990FDBEF.description:
Accurately read on-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate rate and expression on
successive readings.

DB69C818D1A542E6AD991B35DFE81033.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

B20069D90428427C905E972262088887.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

501AA11372B04362B86E9E3A8A96570A.description: Read (150–200) high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

57248B9A68814438B4831EE51BE3E9C1.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate regularly spelled words.

AC8B601A3B4B46FCB7554660428CD1D3.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and
morphology (e.g., base words, roots, and affixes) to accurately read unfamiliar multisyllabic words in and out of context.

820AE3B73F364A739894109A74C5F2AD.description:
Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode short and long sound patterns and
their variants both in isolation and in text.

ADE7FAB2E70149B8B88F41B79B251B2B.description:
Decode monosyllabic and multisyllabic words as appropriate to the student’s communication
modality.

455DB8D0D5964965B855A35CC9EA11E2.description:
Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken
monosyllabic words.

CC8A3623639F4597ABF23FCAA4218BF0.description:
Segment spoken monosyllabic words into their complete sequence of individual sounds
(phonemes).

612369E7199E47B4A7B15DE6CC800B5D.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken monosyllabic words.

524C176DB52843D39099031AC5B43EB2.description:
Manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities, such as singing,
read-alouds, or chants.

64D6A790C275443FB7ACC273D9667BBF.description: Accurately segment monosyllabic and multisyllabic words.

F0C0D9347AD240D6889E5ECF282326C8.description: Orally produce monosyllabic and multisyllabic words by accurately blending sounds.

79A22B75B6E54B28AE62F7D9DEAFB12F.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

D2B5DF14173E498295FD7D04016C1305.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

9F2C5061E096448C84A32176A477EBD7.description: Provide basic reference information of source(s).

2945C441A7834042A7985A1F6D77C330.description: Cite or paraphrase data and conclusions from other sources avoiding plagiarism.

19B5BA4A42894A61A33BB93655648BCE.description: Recognize and gather relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

CB7AC9E27B8F402CBCA11D99371AB87E.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

05CE20E58ED04830A10ACC0AB424FC01.description:
Retell a story, explain a science process, report on a current event, analyze a poem, or recount a
memorable experience using general content-specific words.

B34ED17489134072A3438779323E189F.description:
Retell, explain, and summarize texts and recount experiences using complete sentences, reflecting a logical sequence, key words, and a growing number of academic and content‐ specific words in order to communicate with increasing precision. Use visual displays, digital
resources, or illustrations.

2CC1A59D8CAC4BCE8E6400B4BF6C3DDC.description: Plan and deliver brief oral presentations on a variety of familiar topics using illustrations, digital resources, words, phrases, or vocabulary from a text (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

FB7F05A060124DEB801A5175875C631F.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

3248A3D5B88B427CA101AFD2D7BB4C57.description:
Paraphrase personal experiences and academic concepts, adjusting language choices according to purpose,
context, and audience using grade-appropriate grammar.

A71A73D80F334B22AB7E105E167D3487.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

63453C8B90634A128B354A7AA124EE60.description:
Plan and deliver an informational/explanatory presentation that organizes ideas around major
points of information, follows a logical sequence, includes supporting details, uses clear and specific vocabulary, and provides a strong conclusion.

BF0AB4C1500F485CBE0EA0F2E122C4E7.description:
Elaborate statements, opinions, or arguments with increasing independence using language
models or sentence starters (prompts).

88640211DFC9466F9CD61D71ACE9F3FD.description:
Negotiate with or persuade others in conversations using grade-appropriate vocabulary and open responses to
provide counterarguments.

F2847BD2A5774F4887F86AE2792866AA.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

4C0C3CCCFAC64AE1A883FF234EEC2193.description: Explain fictional and informational texts, conversations, read-alouds, presentations, and experiences using a growing number of general, academic, and content‐specific words to create precision and differences in meaning.

E8BB856C3E8A42CCB6327F38CCE986F2.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

CA4E807E3B93477DAA43127688373994.description:
Expand sentences to provide details about a familiar or new activity, process, or academic
concept.

7230BA40717B4E618BFC4B6E77A9D83F.description: Determine appropriate responses to provide details in shared language activities.

B540B889A52C4F5CAAC53AB6CBFC1FDB.description:
Use correct grammar in expanded simple sentences to express ideas for a variety of purposes,
to respond to simple instructions, and to answer and formulate questions.

862677BC720E425DB13C2092EB718A05.description:
Demonstrate formal greetings, retell texts, and recount experiences using increasingly detailed
complete sentences.

01CB3FCDCDDD4232BF1DB52A52D276B1.description: Respond orally to closed- and open-ended questions.

AC1C7F2A4DA544DBA918AC01FE1F9E50.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

F2FB83D9143641899CEA122E2DE3DBD5.description: Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by following rules, asking and answering questions, and adding relevant information.

29F332FEAAB448EB8CC6ECB9B15B8660.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

8784558BBC834A7A963D08428022A41E.description: Listen and respond to a variety of narrative and informational texts during read-alouds.

6C4475B2EE6D40BB82498FD7F49CCF9E.description: Listen and respond to simple/complex instructions and directions.

A63D742828CC48DD8AE4A04025A11A71.description:
Use verbal and nonverbal forms and simple sentences to demonstrate engagement and
understanding in a socially appropriate manner.

7BC579EC5D204767BAE5368FAD2DEE99.description:
Listen attentively and express appropriate reasoning using personal experience and some
textual evidence.

0A8B6DCF029C426AB66082FA071DD9EB.description:
Ask and answer detailed questions that stimulate conversation. Refer to details from the text as the basis for opinions and conclusions. Use appropriate language structure according to
purpose and setting (formal and informal).

6AEACB72DC6E45C0984B7E98518740AC.description:
React to or answer the 5W and 1H questions in formal and informal discussions using a physical
or verbal response.

4BA0F439FC044467AFF9D316ABAF9280.description:
Listen to and interact with peers during social interactions; read-alouds (fiction and nonfiction texts); oral
presentations; and class, group, and partner discussions.

724B8DFA65B8428782E5A75621464CA9.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
